bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L.O. Howard, March 17, 1925

div1.p: Kean thanks Howard for contacting "Science" on his behalf.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to L.O. Howard, March 17, 1925
div1.opener:
March 17, 1925.
Dr. L. O. Howard,
Chief, Bureau of Entomology,
U. S. Department of Agriculture,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
Thanks for your kind letter of the 16th and
for writing to the Editor of Science. I am sending
you a couple of reprints herewith.

I do not recall that I spoke of myself as
General Kean when we were talking the other day over the
'phone but a good many of my friends both in and out of
the army address me that way on the principle that once
a General always a General as far as thel title goes. I
believe too since my retirement that the Army Regulations
authorize this since they permit retired officers to wear
the uniform and insignia of the highest grade held at
any time while in the service.

With much appreciation of your courtesy and
interest, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired,
Secretary-Treasurer. JRK/W
